Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Strongylocin 2a (UCSS1a; 3S=S, natural AMPs; sea urchin, Echinoidea, marine animals; XXH)
Sequence Information.Source: Live green sea urchins,Strongylocentrotus droebachiensis, Norway, Europe

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: isoform 2b not yet isolated.Chemical modification:  W1 was deduced from the cDNA sequence but not determined from Edman degradation. It appears to be modified, likely bromination (MS). The position of bromination (5 or 6) is unclear.Activity: Active against Gram- L. anguillarum serotype O2 (MIC 1.3 uM), E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 5.0 uM), Gram+ C. glutamicum ATCC 13032 (MIC 2.5 uM), and S. aureus ATCC 9144 (MIC 2.5 uM). The minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) was set at the lowest concentration of peptide reducing the OD to less than 50% of the growth control.Toxicity: not hemolytic at 17.5 uM.Updated 7/2021; 11/2023
Literature Information.Author: Li C, Haug T, Styrvold OB, Jørgensen TØ, Stensvåg K.2008
Literature Information.Title: Strongylocins, novel antimicrobial peptides from the green sea urchin, Strongylocentrotus droebachiensis
